page.title: 02CROFTING AT BADLUARACH
page.content: THERE ARE NOW ONLY TWO FAMILIES IN BADLUARACH WHO WORK THEIR CROFTS,AND THOSE ONLY ON A PART-TIME BASIS.ONE FAMILY KEEPS TWO COWSAND FOLLOWERS, AND BOTH HAVE ABOUT 50 BREEDING EWES. EACH FAMILY OWNS A TRACTOR,BUT ALL THE WINTER FEED IS BOUGHT IN. BOTH COWS ARE ABERDEEN-ANGUS COSS, BUT ONE IS KEPT AS AMILKING COW FOR THE FAMILY. THE SHEEP ARE MAINLY BLACK-FACE, CROSSED WITH CHEVIOT,BUT ONE FLOCK HAS HEBRIDEAN CROSSES.DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE TUPS ARE USED.ONE FAMILY FEEDS OATS AT LAMBING TIME;THE OTHER PULP NUTS FROM JANUARY ONWARDS. MOST FAMILIES IN BADLUARACH KEEP A FEW HENS AND HAVE SMALL VEGETABLE GARDENS.THERE ARE NO PRIVATE FORESTRY PLANTATIONS IN BADLUARACH.
